Instructions.text: Let's learn about the components of the process view. Go to the process window by pressing 'Back' on the top of this screen then check what are the components available.
options: Feed, Cell Parameters (Air, Froth), Concentrate, Tailings

Instructions.text: Excellent. Go back to the process and check out the Tailings's graphs. What is the actual Cu Grade on that stream?
I guess the Cu recovery of this process could be increased. Check the process menu and increase the air flow. What happened to the Concentrate Cu recovery?
What happened to the Cu grade - the amount of copper in the concentrate?

That is because recovery is a compromise between quantity and quality. With more air you lose a bit on the amount of copper (since other minerals are also floating) but you win on quantity (flow rate).
The copper recovery (seen in the Concentrate section) is a good estimate on how good you are doing your job. In next exercises we will learn how to calculate it using data from the Feed stream.
You did well! See you soon.
